weekly picks (Jul 4 week 2022)

Posted on July 18, 2022 in 2022jul 

A WordCloud of 2022 Jul 4th week collection

  1. s41586-022-04864-1 Perpendicular full switching of chiral antiferromagnetic order by current (Mn3Sn, Nature)

  2. 2207.10103 Braiding with Supersymmetric Majorana Lattices (braiding, arXiv)

  3. 2207.10113 Higher-Order Topological Lattice Defects in Iron-based Superconductors (higher order defect, arXiv)

  4. 2207.10166 Spin singlet and quasiparticles excitations in cuprate superconductors (arXiv)

  5. 2207.10608 Incommensurate charge-stripe correlations in the kagome superconductor CsV$3$Sb${5-x}$Sn$_x$ (kagome, arXiv)

  6. 2207.10087 An intermediate-scale theory for electrons coupled to frustrated local-moments (RMoessner, arXiv)

  7. 2207.10099 Spin-Resolved Topology and Partial Axion Angles in Three-Dimensional Insulators (arXiv)

  8. 2207.10291 Evidence for electronic signature of magnetic transition in topological magnet HoSbTe (arXiv)

  9. 2207.10535 Competition between magnetic frustration and spin dimensionality in the ground state of the classical antiferromagnetic $n$-vector model with arbitrary $n$ (arXiv)

  10. PhysRevLett.129.046802 Anomalous Crystal Shapes of Topological Crystalline Insulators (PRL)

  11. PhysRevB.106.014107 Carbon and vacancy centers in hexagonal boron nitride (defect, PRB)

  12. PhysRevB.106.035141 Cluster quantum Monte Carlo study of two-dimensional weakly coupled frustrated trimer antiferromagnets (breathing kagome, PRB)

  13. PhysRevB.106.045129 Impact of electron-electron interactions on the thermoelectric efficiency of graphene quantum point contacts (PRB)

  14. PhysRevB.106.024420 Canted antiferromagnetic phases in the candidate layered Weyl material ${\mathrm{EuMnSb}}_{2}$ (magnetic Weyl, PRB)

  15. PhysRevB.106.024421 Electronic chiralization as an indicator of the anomalous Hall effect in unconventional magnetic systems (chirality magnetic system, PRB)

  16. PhysRevB.106.035417 Electronic and spintronic properties of Janus $M{\mathrm{Si}}{2}{\mathrm{P}}{x}{\mathrm{As}}_{y}$ ($M$ = Mo, W) monolayers (Janus, PRB)

  17. 2207.09492 The nature of visons in the perturbed ferromagnetic and antiferromagnetic Kitaev honeycomb models (arXiv)

  18. 2207.09549 The fate of topological frustration in quantum spin ladders and generalizations (frustration, arXiv)

  19. 2207.09698 Quantum phase transition between hyperuniform density distributions (arXiv)

  20. PhysRevLett.129.046402 Fermi Surface and Mass Renormalization in the Iron-Based Superconductor ${\mathrm{YFe}}{2}{\mathrm{Ge}}{2}$ (PRL)

  21. PhysRevB.106.045126 Generalized fermion doubling theorems: Classification of two-dimensional nodal systems in terms of wallpaper groups (PRB)

  22. PhysRevB.106.035134 Planar magnetic texture on the surface of a topological insulator (magnetic TI, PRB)

  23. PhysRevB.106.035137 Proximity effects in graphene on monolayers of transition-metal phosphorus trichalcogenides $M\mathrm{P}{X}_{3}$ $(M:\mathrm{Mn}, \mathrm{Fe}, \mathrm{Ni}, \mathrm{Co}, \mathrm{and} X: \mathrm{S}, \mathrm{Se})$ (PRB)

  24. PhysRevB.106.035138 Generalized Gibbs ensemble description of real-space entanglement spectra of $(2+1)$-dimensional chiral topological systems with SU(2) symmetry (PRB)

  25. PhysRevB.106.035139 Robust propagating in-gap modes due to spin-orbit domain walls in graphene (spin-orbit domain walls, PRB)

  26. PhysRevB.106.045303 Longitudinal and transverse frictional drag in graphene/${\mathrm{LaAlO}}{3}/{\mathrm{SrTiO}}{3}$ heterostructures (PRB)

  27. PhysRevB.106.014413 Dominant Kitaev interactions in the honeycomb materials ${\mathrm{Na}}{3}{\mathrm{Co}}{2}{\mathrm{SbO}}{6}$ and ${\mathrm{Na}}{2}{\mathrm{Co}}{2}{\mathrm{TeO}}{6}$ (PRB)

  28. PhysRevB.106.014514 Enhanced superconductivity in ${\mathrm{CuH}}_{2}$ monolayers (hydride, PRB)

  29. PhysRevB.106.014515 Sensitivity of superconducting states to the impurity location in layered materials (PRB)

  30. PhysRevB.106.035136 First-principles study on the magnetic and electronic properties of the high-pressure orthorhombic phase of MnSe (PRB)

  31. 2207.09017 Interacting Majorana fermion model with spontaneous symmetry breaking and topological order: exact ground state with intertwined spin and pairing orders (majorana, arXiv)

  32. 2207.09443 Topological Superconductivity From Forward Phonon Scatterings (arXiv)

  33. 2207.08840 Chiral spin chain interfaces as event horizons (arXiv)

  34. 2207.08851 Fresnel-Floquet theory of light-induced terahertz reflectivity amplification in Ta2NiSe5 (arXiv)

  35. 2207.08895 Anomalous Hall metal and fractional Chern insulator in twisted transition metal dichalcogenides (LiangFu, arXiv)

  36. 2207.08969 Evidences for magnetic dimers and skyrmion lattice formation in Eu$_2$Pd$_2$Sn (skyrmion, arXiv)

  37. 2207.09297 Magnetic interactions in AB-stacked kagome lattices: magnetic structure, symmetry, and duality (Mn3Sn, arXiv)

  39. 2207.09449 Correlated Fractional Dirac Materials (fractional Dirac, rXiv)

  46. s98 A Conceptual Cousin for Twisted Bilayer Graphene (Physics)

  47. 2207.07962v1 Conservation of the particle-hole symmetry in the pseudogap state in optimally-doped Bi2Sr2CuO6+{\delta} superconductor (cuprate, arxiv)

  48. 2207.08068 Charge-loop current order and Z3 nematicity mediated by bond-order fluctuations in kagome metal AV3Sb5 (A=Cs,Rb,K) (kagome Kontani, arXiv)

  50. 2207.08442 Pressure tuning domain-wall chirality in noncentrosymmetric magnetic Weyl semimetal CeAlGe (Ce, arXiv)

  53. 2207.08772 Josephson Diode Effect in High Mobility InSb Nanoflags (arXiv)

  55. 2207.07725v1 Preparing Valence-Bond-Solid states on noisy intermediate-scale quantum computers (arxiv)

  56. 2207.07926 Estimation of the on-site Coulomb potential 1 and covalent state in La2CuO4 by muon spin rotation 2 and density functional theory calculations (arXiv)

  57. 2207.08008 Mott transition, Widom line, Frenkel line and pseudogap in the half-filled triangular lattice Hubbard model (arXiv)

  58. 2207.08161 Field-linear anomalous Hall effect and Berry curvature induced by spin chirality in the kagome antiferromagnet Mn3Sn (BinghaiYan, arXiv)
